**Planning skill resolution and execution flow**

I'm deciding to implement resolution as fetching skill details plus creating a skill instance, triggered by a "Resolve" button after skill selection, which will enable execution with the instance ID shown in the UI. This requires adding UI elements to the existing Alden skills view, possibly as a new panel or an extension of current columns.

**Designing new skill system panel**

I'm planning to add a new `SkillSystemPanel` component within the existing Alden skills view, placed in the left column above or replacing SkillMarketplace, to handle listing, resolving, and executing skills via SynapseBridge. This includes managing state for skills, selection, instances, and execution results, plus updating tests and mocks accordingly.

payload.text:
**Planning skill resolution and execution flow**

Deciding to set a constant agentId and trigger skill resolution immediately on selection by calling getSkill and creating an instance. I'll add data-testid attributes for resolution details and instance ID, implement an Execute button calling executeSkill with fixed inputs, and track execution calls via window logs to verify correct backend interaction in tests while also showing results in the UI.

**Designing UI and mocks for skill system panel**

Outline includes a SkillSystemPanel with loading, error, selection, resolve, and execute states, decorated with data-testid for E2E testing. Planning mock command handlers serialized into page context to track calls in `window.__SKILL_MOCK_STATE__`, enabling verification of backend command invocation while also restructuring the main layout to integrate the new panel alongside existing components.

**Planning skill manifest and test setup**

I'm deciding to include duration_ms in responses and have `synapse_get_skill` return the skill manifest with permissions as a simple array in mocks. For tests, I'll rely on Mocks.install (which sets localStorage) and navigate to the Alden Skills tab using existing role-based selectors similar to prior tests, ensuring to wait for app readiness.

**Designing isolated E2E tests with skill mock tracking**

I'm outlining three focused tests for discovery, resolution, and execution flows using data-testid selectors and custom skill handlers that record calls on `window.__SKILL_MOCK_STATE__`. Each test will set up mocks and navigation in beforeEach, with Mocks.reset afterEach, ensuring isolation and clear call assertions. Next, I'll add a new component with test IDs and update Alden's skill view accordingly before implementing the tests file.

payload.text:
**Summarizing additions and next steps**

Added a new SkillSystemPanel component integrated into the Alden skills view to test the synapse skill registry/resolver/executor, accompanied by new end-to-end tests using IPC mocks. Key files include `SkillSystemPanel.tsx`, `AldenCommandCenter.tsx`, and `skill-system.spec.ts`. The panel and tests introduce several new data-testid attributes (`skill-system-panel`, `skill-registry-list`, `skill-registry-item`, `skill-resolve-button`, `skill-execute-button`, `skill-resolution-name`, `skill-instance-id`, `skill-execution-status`, `skill-registry-refresh`, `skill-registry`, `skill-system-error`) to support testing. Tests have not been run; it's recommended to execute them via `npx playwright test tests/e2e/skill-system.spec.ts`. Next steps: (1) run tests to verify functionality, (2) address any test failures or coverage gaps, (3) consider expanding test IDs if needed for future components.

Added a Synapse-backed SkillSystem panel in the Alden Skills view to expose registry â†’ resolver â†’ executor actions, and replaced the E2E spec with focused Playwright coverage that mocks `synapse_*` IPC commands and verifies discovery, resolution, and execution flows.
- New UI harness for the skill flow in `src/components/skills/SkillSystemPanel.tsx`, wired into the Alden Skills layout in `src/components/alden/AldenCommandCenter.tsx`.
- New E2E suite with stable data-testid selectors and IPC call assertions in `tests/e2e/skill-system.spec.ts`.
- New test IDs added: `skill-system-panel`, `skill-registry`, `skill-registry-list`, `skill-registry-item`, `skill-registry-refresh`, `skill-resolve-button`, `skill-execute-button`, `skill-resolution`, `skill-resolution-name`, `skill-instance-id`, `skill-execution-status`, `skill-system-error`.

Tests not run.

Next steps:
1) `npx playwright test tests/e2e/skill-system.spec.ts`
